intro: Viola hirta subsp. permixta, commonly known as the purple violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and heart-shaped, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of violet-blue flowers with five petals, often featuring a distinctive dark violet marking on the lower petal. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
